label: WDS2
info_overview: WiDom Smart Double Switch is an ON/OFF control device designed to independently control two separate loads, suited for being controlled by both remote and local switches. Similarly to the other WiDom “in wall” devices, it can be fully integrated into pre-existing systems and configured to associate configurable behaviors to a specific number of clicks, in full integration with the Z-Wave home automation ecosystem. There are two versions of WiDom Double Switch: L version controlled by Line signal; N version controlled by Neutral signal
info_inclusion: Before including the device the LED status indicator is solid RED. The procedure of inclusion is activated by clicking Add in the inclusion interface and by pressing any sequence of click on the integrated button. As soon as the inclusion procedure initiates the LED indicator starts a sequence of GREEN-BLUE blinks. The device is included in the network when the LED status is OFF and the interview is completed.
info_exclusion: Only a controller can remove the device from the network. After activating the exclusion function by the controller, the device can be removed by setting it in Learning Mode. If you are using the WiDom Multi Sensor Room Controller, the procedure of exclusion can be activated by Removing a node from the Z-Wave network and any click sequence on the integrated button; as soon as the exclusion initiates, the LED indicator starts a sequence of RED-BLUE blinks. The device is excluded from the network when the LED status indicator is solid RED and the App_status in the interface is OK.
info_usage:
Control Actions :

  • Holding the I1/I2 button change the status of Channel1/Channel2 and return to previous status as soon as the button is released.
  • A single and/or more clicks (Parameter No.1) on the I1 button turn ON/OFF the Channel 1 load.
  • A single and/or more clicks (Parameter No.2 and No. 1) on the button I2 turn ON/OFF the Channel 2 load.
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Numbers of clicks to control Channel 1
parameters.description: Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to Channel 1/2.
parameters.overview: Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to both Channel 1 and Channel 2, if parameter No. 2 is set to its default value. Otherwise parameter No.1 sets the clicks sequence only for Channel 1 and parameter No. 2 sets the clicks sequence for Channel 2

options.label: DISABLED
options.overview: Local Control disabled

options.label: ONE_CLICK
options.overview: 1 click controls the local load

options.label: TWO_CLICKS
options.overview: 2 clicks control the local load

options.label: ONE_CLICK or TWO_CLICKS
options.overview: 1 or 2 clicks control the local load

options.label: THREE_CLICKS
options.overview: 3 clicks control the local load

options.label: ONE_CLICK or THREE_CLICKS
options.overview: 1 click or 3 clicks control the local load

options.label: ONE_CLICK, TWO_CLICKS or THREE_CLICKS
options.overview: 1 click, 2 clicks or 3 clicks control the local load

parameters.label: Numbers of clicks to control Channel 2
parameters.description: Define which sequences of click control the load connected to Channel 2

options.label: DISABLED
options.overview: Local Control disabled

options.label: ONE_CLICK
options.overview: 1 click controls the local load

options.label: TWO_CLICKS

options.overview: 1 click or 2 clicks control the local load

options.overview: 3 clicks control the local load

options.label: ONE_CLICK or THREE_CLICKS
options.overview: 1 click or 2 clicks control the load

options.label: TWO_CLICKS or THREE_CLICKS
options.overview: 2 clicks or 3 clicks control the local load

options.label: EQUAL_TO_CHANNEL_1
options.overview: The load connected to the Channel 2 will be controlled with the same number of clicks configured for Channel 1

parameters.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 2
parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 2 when I1 button receive 1 Click

options.label: Basic Set with same value of channel status

parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 5 when I2 button receive 1 Click

options.label: Basic Set with same value of channel status

options.label: Basic Set with same value of channel status

options.label: Basic Set with same value of channel status

parameters.label: Timer to switch OFF the Channel 1
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 1 is switched OFF

parameters.label: Timer to switch OFF the Channel 2
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 2 is switched OFF

parameters.label: Timer to switch ON the Channel 1
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 1 is switched ON

parameters.label: Timer to switch ON the Channel 2
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 2 is switched ON

parameters.label: Local Scenario
parameters.description: Defines the behavior of the device Channels
parameters.overview: Defines the behavior of the device Channels when the I1/I2 buttons receive a valid number of clicks (see Parameters No. 1 and No. 2).

options.label: INDIPENDENT_CHANNELS
options.overview: I1 button control Channel 1 and I2 button contr

options.label: NEVER_BOTH_ON
options.overview: Both channels can be OFF but they can never be ON simultaneously

options.label: SEQUENCING_RELAY
options.overview: Channels are toggled in this order: both channels ON, only Channel 1 ON, only Channel 2 ON, both channels OFF.

parameters.label: Start-up status
parameters.description: Defines the status of the device following a restart.

options.label: OFF_OFF  - Both Channel 1 and Channel 2 OFF
ON_ON - Both Channel 1 and Channel 2 ON
PREVIOUS STATUS - Status prior to restart

parameters.label: Type of external switch both inputs
parameters.description: Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2.
parameters.overview: Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2, if parameter No. 63 is set in its default value. Otherwise parameter No. 62 defines only the switch connected to the input 1 and parameter No. 63 the switch connected to the input 2.

options.label: IGNORE
options.overview: The actions on the external switch are ignored

options.label: BUTTON
options.overview: The external switch is a normally open button

options.label: SWITCH
options.overview: The external switch is a traditional switch

parameters.label: Type of external switch input 2
parameters.description: Define the switch type connected to the input 2

options.label: IGNORE
options.overview: The actions on the external switch are ignored

options.label: BUTTON
options.overview: The external switch is a normally open button

options.label: SWITCH
options.overview: The external switch is a traditional switch

options.label: EQUAL TO SWITCH 1
options.overview: The external switch connected to input 2 is equal to the switch connected to the input 1 defined by parameter No. 62

			<Maximum>7</Maximum>

			</Item>

			<Item>

			<Default>100</Default>

			<Maximum>100</Maximum>

			<Item>
				<Value>0</Value>
				<Label lang="en">Basic Set OFF</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>-1</Value>
				<Label lang="en">Basic Set ON</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>100</Value>
				<Label lang="en">Basic Set with same value of channel status</Label>
			</Item>
			<Help lang="en">Value used for devices belonging to Group 7 when I2 button receive 3 Clicks</Help>
		</Parameter>	
		<Parameter>
			<Index>10</Index>
			<Type>byte</Type>
			<Default>0</Default>
			<Minimum>0</Minimum>
			<Maximum>32000</Maximum>
			<Size>2</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Timer to switch OFF the Channel 1</Label>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the time after which the Channel 1 is switched OFF</Help>
		</Parameter>
		<Parameter>
			<Index>11</Index>
			<Type>byte</Type>
			<Default>0</Default>
			<Minimum>0</Minimum>
			<Maximum>32000</Maximum>
			<Size>2</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Timer to switch OFF the Channel 2</Label>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the time after which the Channel 2 is switched OFF</Help>
		</Parameter>
		<Parameter>
			<Index>12</Index>
			<Type>byte</Type>
			<Default>0</Default>
			<Minimum>0</Minimum>
			<Maximum>32000</Maximum>
			<Size>2</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Timer to switch ON the Channel 1</Label>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the time after which the Channel 1 is switched ON</Help>
		</Parameter>
		<Parameter>
			<Index>11</Index>
			<Type>byte</Type>
			<Default>0</Default>
			<Minimum>0</Minimum>
			<Maximum>32000</Maximum>
			<Size>2</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Timer to switch ON the Channel 2</Label>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the time after which the Channel 2 is switched ON</Help>
		</Parameter>	
		<Parameter>
			<Index>40</Index>
			<Type>list</Type>
			<Default>0</Default>
			<Size>1</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Local Scenario</Label>
			<Item>
				<Value>0</Value>
				<Label lang="en">INDIPENDENT_CHANNELS - I1 button control Channel 1 and I2 button control Channel 2</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>1</Value>
				<Label lang="en">NEVER_BOTH_ON - Both channels can be OFF but they can never be ON simultaneously</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>2</Value>
				<Label lang="en">SEQUENCING_RELAY - Channels are toggled in this order: both channels ON, only Channel 1 ON, only Channel 2 ON, both channels OFF.</Label>
			</Item>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the behavior of the device Channels when the I1/I2 buttons receive a valid number of clicks (see Parameters No. 1 and No. 2).</Help>
		</Parameter>
		<Parameter>
			<Index>60</Index>
			<Type>list</Type>
			<Default>4</Default>
			<Size>1</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Start-up status</Label>
			<Item>
				<Value>0</Value>
				<Label lang="en">OFF_OFF  - Both Channel 1 and Channel 2 OFF</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>1</Value>
				<Label lang="en">OFF_ON - Channel 1 OFF, Channel  2 ON</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>2</Value>
				<Label lang="en">ON_OFF - Channel 1 ON, Channel 2 OFF</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>3</Value>
				<Label lang="en">ON_ON - Both Channel 1 and Channel 2 ON</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>4</Value>
				<Label lang="en">PREVIOUS STATUS - Status prior to restart</Label>
			</Item>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the status of the device following a restart.</Help>
		</Parameter>
		<Parameter>
			<Index>62</Index>
			<Type>list</Type>
			<Default>1</Default>
			<Size>1</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Type of external switch</Label>
			<Item>
				<Value>0</Value>
				<Label lang="en">IGNORE - The actions on the external switch are ignored</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>1</Value>
				<Label lang="en">BUTTON - The external switch is a normally open button</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>2</Value>
				<Label lang="en">SWITCH - The external switch is a traditional switch</Label>
			</Item>
			<Help lang="en">Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2, if parameter No. 63 is set in its default value.
			Otherwise parameter No. 62 defines only the switch connected to the input 1 and parameter No. 63 the switch connected to the input 2.</Help>
		</Parameter>
		<Parameter>
			<Index>63</Index>
			<Type>list</Type>
			<Default>3</Default>
			<Size>1</Size>
			<Label lang="en">Type of external switch</Label>
			<Item>
				<Value>0</Value>
				<Label lang="en">IGNORE - The actions on the external switch are ignored</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>1</Value>
				<Label lang="en">BUTTON - The external switch is a normally open button</Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>2</Value>
				<Label lang="en">SWITCH - The external switch is a traditional switch </Label>
			</Item>
			<Item>
				<Value>3</Value>
				<Label lang="en">EQUAL TO SWITCH 1 - The external switch connected to input 2 is equal to the switch connected to the input 1 defined by parameter No. 62</Label>
			</Item>
			<Help lang="en">Define the switch type connected to the input 2</Help>
		</Parameter>		
	</Configuration>
	<Associations>
		<Group>
        	<Index>1</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">Group 1</Label>
        	<SetToController>true</SetToController>
        </Group>
        <Group>
            <Index>2</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">1 click Button S1</Label>
        </Group>
        <Group>
        	<Index>3</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">2 clicks Button S1</Label>
        </Group>
		<Group>
        	<Index>4</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">3 clicks Button S1</Label>
        </Group>
        <Group>
            <Index>5</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">1 click Button S2</Label>
        </Group>
        <Group>
        	<Index>6</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">2 clicks Button S2</Label>
        </Group>
				<Group>
        	<Index>7</Index>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <Label lang="en">3 clicks Button S2</Label>
        </Group>
	</Associations>
</Product>

0x5E 0x25 0x32 0x60 0x85 0x82 0x59 0x86 0x72 0x5A 0x73 0x70 0x98 0x7A 0x55 0x9F 0x6C

Overview

WiDom Smart Double Switch is an ON/OFF control device designed to independently control two separate loads, suited for being controlled by both remote and local switches. Similarly to the other WiDom “in wall” devices, it can be fully integrated into pre-existing systems and configured to associate configurable behaviors to a specific number of clicks, in full integration with the Z-Wave home automation ecosystem. There are two versions of WiDom Double Switch: L version controlled by Line signal; N version controlled by Neutral signal


Inclusion Information

Before including the device the LED status indicator is solid RED. The procedure of inclusion is activated by clicking Add in the inclusion interface and by pressing any sequence of click on the integrated button. As soon as the inclusion procedure initiates the LED indicator starts a sequence of GREEN-BLUE blinks. The device is included in the network when the LED status is OFF and the interview is completed.


Exclusion Information

Only a controller can remove the device from the network. After activating the exclusion function by the controller, the device can be removed by setting it in Learning Mode. If you are using the WiDom Multi Sensor Room Controller, the procedure of exclusion can be activated by Removing a node from the Z-Wave network and any click sequence on the integrated button; as soon as the exclusion initiates, the LED indicator starts a sequence of RED-BLUE blinks. The device is excluded from the network when the LED status indicator is solid RED and the App_status in the interface is OK.

]]> WallSwitch wiDom WDS2 0149 1214:0B00 986 1 setup link

Overview

Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to both Channel 1 and Channel 2, if parameter No. 2 is set to its default value. Otherwise parameter No.1 sets the clicks sequence only for Channel 1 and parameter No. 2 sets the clicks sequence for Channel 2

xml.xml:
Overview

WiDom Smart Double Switch is an ON/OFF control device designed to independently control two separate loads, suited for being controlled by both remote and local switches. Similarly to the other WiDom “in wall” devices, it can be fully integrated into pre-existing systems and configured to associate configurable behaviors to a specific number of clicks, in full integration with the Z-Wave home automation ecosystem. There are two versions of WiDom Double Switch: L version controlled by Line signal; N version controlled by Neutral signal


Inclusion Information

Before including the device the LED status indicator is solid RED. The procedure of inclusion is activated by clicking Add in the inclusion interface and by pressing any sequence of click on the integrated button. As soon as the inclusion procedure initiates the LED indicator starts a sequence of GREEN-BLUE blinks. The device is included in the network when the LED status is OFF and the interview is completed.


Exclusion Information

Only a controller can remove the device from the network. After activating the exclusion function by the controller, the device can be removed by setting it in Learning Mode. If you are using the WiDom Multi Sensor Room Controller, the procedure of exclusion can be activated by Removing a node from the Z-Wave network and any click sequence on the integrated button; as soon as the exclusion initiates, the LED indicator starts a sequence of RED-BLUE blinks. The device is excluded from the network when the LED status indicator is solid RED and the App_status in the interface is OK.

]]> WallSwitch wiDom WDS2 0149 1214:0B00 986 1 setup link

Overview

Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to both Channel 1 and Channel 2, if parameter No. 2 is set to its default value. Otherwise parameter No.1 sets the clicks sequence only for Channel 1 and parameter No. 2 sets the clicks sequence for Channel 2

Overview

WiDom Smart Double Switch is an ON/OFF control device designed to independently control two separate loads, suited for being controlled by both remote and local switches. Similarly to the other WiDom “in wall” devices, it can be fully integrated into pre-existing systems and configured to associate configurable behaviors to a specific number of clicks, in full integration with the Z-Wave home automation ecosystem. There are two versions of WiDom Double Switch: L version controlled by Line signal; N version controlled by Neutral signal


Inclusion Information

Before including the device the LED status indicator is solid RED. The procedure of inclusion is activated by clicking Add in the inclusion interface and by pressing any sequence of click on the integrated button. As soon as the inclusion procedure initiates the LED indicator starts a sequence of GREEN-BLUE blinks. The device is included in the network when the LED status is OFF and the interview is completed.


Exclusion Information

Only a controller can remove the device from the network. After activating the exclusion function by the controller, the device can be removed by setting it in Learning Mode. If you are using the WiDom Multi Sensor Room Controller, the procedure of exclusion can be activated by Removing a node from the Z-Wave network and any click sequence on the integrated button; as soon as the exclusion initiates, the LED indicator starts a sequence of RED-BLUE blinks. The device is excluded from the network when the LED status indicator is solid RED and the App_status in the interface is OK.
